main_definition: To suspend or be supported from something, typically by a hook or rope.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To remain in the air after falling from a higher position
meanings_and_examples.example: After slipping on the ice, he hung for a moment before landing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have an emotional or psychological impact on someone, often negative
meanings_and_examples.example: The bad news hanged me up and I felt depressed all day.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To engage in gambling at a casino
meanings_and_examples.example: He hung around the roulette table, watching people place their bets.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To keep or store an item on display or for future use
meanings_and_examples.example: She hung her collection of antique vases on the wall to admire them.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To attach a picture, decoration, or other object onto something else using adhesive or hooks
meanings_and_examples.example: He hung up his painting above the sofa in the living room.
